com.nitrous.gwt.earth.client.api
Class KmlLink

java.lang.Object

                  com.nitrous.gwt.earth.client.api.KmlLink
Direct Known Subclasses:
KmlIcon
public class KmlLink
extends KmlObject

Specifies the location of any KML files fetched by network links, image files used by icons in icon styles, ground overlays, and screen overlays, or model files used in the Model object.

Author:
Nick

Constructor Detail

KmlLink

protected KmlLink()
Method Detail

getHref

public final java.lang.String getHref()
Returns:
A URL (either an HTTP address or a local file specification). When the parent of Link is a NetworkLink, href is a KML file. When the parent of Link is a Model, href is a COLLADA file. When the parent of Link is an Overlay, href is an image.

setHref

public final void setHref(java.lang.String href)
Parameters:
href - A URL (either an HTTP address or a local file specification). When the parent of Link is a NetworkLink, href is a KML file. When the parent of Link is a Model, href is a COLLADA file. When the parent of Link is an Overlay, href is an image.

Parameters:

getViewBoundScale

public final float getViewBoundScale()
Scales the BBOX parameters before sending them to the server. A value less than 1 specifies to use less than the full view (screen). A value greater than 1 specifies to fetch an area that extends beyond the edges of the current view.

Returns:

setViewBoundScale

public final void setViewBoundScale(float viewBoundScale)
Scales the BBOX parameters before sending them to the server. A value less than 1 specifies to use less than the full view (screen). A value greater than 1 specifies to fetch an area that extends beyond the edges of the current view.

Parameters:
viewBoundScale -

getViewFormat

public final java.lang.String getViewFormat()
Specifies the format of the query string that is appended to the Link's href before the file is fetched.(If the href specifies a local file, this element is ignored.)

Returns:

setViewFormat

public final void setViewFormat(java.lang.String viewFormat)
Specifies the format of the query string that is appended to the Link's href before the file is fetched.(If the href specifies a local file, this element is ignored.)
